alert.note: Alert for Death Valley National Park; Owens Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 3:52PM PST until January 10 at 10:00PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following areas, Death Valley National Park and Owens Valley. * WHEN...Until 11 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of washes, creeks, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Persistent rainfall rates of a quarter inch per hour can be expected in the Owens Valley and parts of Death Valley before rain tapers this evening leading to total rainfall amounts between one and two inches for some areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Death Valley National Park; Owens Valley
